feed.title: SAP Community - Cloud Integration
feed.subtitle: Cloud Integration Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: How Can I Use the SuccesFactors Adapter with NavPath
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I don't know how to configure the following address in the SuccessFactors Adapter and perform a GET operation. Could you please inform me?

 

"...eu/odata/v2/FormCustom(formContentId=<id>,formDataId=<id>,sectionIndex=14)/customElement"

 

Thanks.

entry.title: Integration Suite Cloud Connector Connectivity Test fails
entry.content:
I'm trying to set up Cloud Connector to my BTP and Integration Suite so I can access SMB shares on an internal Windows 11 server.

Everything I can see the status of, looks like everything is working except it seems Integration Suite isn't talking to BTP,  maybe.

Here are screenshots of everything I have running.

Cloud Connector on Windows Machine

This windows machine has confirmed access to the SMB file share I want to get files from.

Tested in PowerShell and basic authentication user name and password are verified working.

 

Status of that cloud connector

 Status of connection in BTP

I set up a "Destination" in BTP as a test as well just to see and that checks out.

But, now In integration suite if I try and use this in a SMB Adapter in an iFlow I get errors (some details obscured, my company is very sensitive)

All of the parameters are 100% correct (as long as this is what is supposed to go there).

Address is the virtual address I have set up.

Location ID is the Location ID is have set up in Cloud Connector on the Windows Machine

Share is the name of the Share Drive I'm trying to access via SMB on the Windows Machine

Credentials Name is set up and deployed and verified as correct username and password that can access the SMB share at the destination.

"org.apache.camel.CamelException: <Exception><Message>Error in Session connect: On-Premise connection failed for bXX-XXX:445. Ensure cloud connector is configured correctly for location id : us-XXX-XXX and host is exposed correctly in your cloud connector. SMB uses TCP as protocol. Error : SOCKS5 command failed with status: NETWORK_UNREACHABLE</Message></Exception>"

Also, in Integration Suite, if I go to "Monitor->Manage Security->Connectivity Tests->Cloud Connector"

and put in my location ID the only feedback I get is "Could not connect to Cloud Connector" error.

Not sure how to proceed to try and get this working.

entry.title: Cloud Integration Certificate with Key Size upper than 2048
entry.content:
Hi All,

it should be possibile to obtain directly from SAP, using an SR request, a new sap_cloudintegrationcertificate on IS Tenant with:

  • Key Size: 3072
  • Signature Algorithm: sha256ECDSA
  • Issude by: DigiCert

I know tha we have already the 2048 one, but for security constraint we need a new version with a 3072 Key Size.

 

Thanks

Regards

entry.title: CPI message mapping error for attribute xml:lang
entry.content:
Dear experts,

I'm trying to simulate passing value to an attribute named "xml:lang" from a test xsd. I was able to successfully import the test xsd by creating a local download of https://www.w3.org/2001/xml.xsd and uploading it as part of the message mapping references with the name 2001.xsd.  

I've passed constant values to all the elements and attributes but simulation results in Test error, if i set the attribute "xml:lang" to optional I'm able to simulate the message mapping but the attribute is missing. Could you advise how to handle this or if there's no other way other than thru XSLT or Groovy script?

 

<xsd:schema xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"
    xmlns:xml="http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace"
    elementFormDefault="unqualified">

    <xsd:import namespace="http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace"
        schemaLocation="2001.xsd" />

    <xsd:element name="start">
        <xsd:complexType>
            <xsd:sequence>
                <xsd:element name="targetelement">
                    <xsd:complexType>
                        <xsd:simpleContent>
                            <xsd:extension base="xsd:string">
                                <xsd:attribute ref="xml:lang" use="required"/>
                            </xsd:extension>
                        </xsd:simpleContent>
                    </xsd:complexType>
                </xsd:element>
            </xsd:sequence>
        </xsd:complexType>
    </xsd:element>

</xsd:schema>

entry.title: MP: exception caught with cause com.sap.engine.services.jndi.persistent.exceptions720.Namespac in PI
entry.content:
Hello Experts,
We are facing an issue in SAP PI/PO where the message is processed successfully and delivered to the target system, but the sender receives an HTTP 500 error. In the logs we see the following:

MP: exception caught with cause com.sap.engine.services.jndi.persistent.exceptions720.NameNotFoundException: Object not found in lookup of NamespaceMapperBean.

Even though message delivery is successful, this exception still appears and causes the user to see a 500 Internal Server Error.

Could you please advise what could cause this..

Thank you

entry.title: CPI HTTP Receiver always returns 400 “Syntax Error” although same JSON works in Postman
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

We are trying to call a BZSt REST endpoint from SAP Cloud Integration (CPI) using the HTTP Receiver adapter. The goal is to send a small JSON request from our SAP backend to the German EVATR service and receive a validation response.

The same request (same URL, same JSON body, same token/parameters) works perfectly in Postman. In CPI, however, we consistently receive an HTTP 400 error from the target system.

The error message in the CPI log is:

org.apache.camel.component.ahc.AhcOperationFailedException:
HTTP operation failed invoking https://api.evatr.vies.bzst.de/app/v1/abfrage with statusCode: 400

 The response body from the server is an HTML error page:

<html>
<head>
<base href="/error_path/">
<title>400 Bad Request</title>
</head>
<body>
<h1>Bad Request</h1>
<p>The server detected a syntax error in your request.<br>
Check your request and all parameters.</p>

<p>Your request ID was: aSW1_biQek9iXbaem_MTxwAABZY</p>
</body>
</html>

In the meantime, we have tested quite a lot of variations. We tried many different header combinations, including explicitly setting headers like Content-Type, Accept, Host, and Content-Length, and we experimented with the “Allowed / Request Headers” setting of the HTTP Receiver adapter (including using *). None of these attempts changed the behavior – CPI still only seems to forward a very small set of headers, and additional headers set via a Content Modifier often do not appear in the actual outbound call (according to the HTTP_Receiver_Adapter_Request_Headers attachment).

We also experimented with the payload itself: different JSON formats, slightly modified test payloads, sending the exact same body as Postman, and even building a minimal iFlow where the JSON body is hard-coded in a Content Modifier and sent directly to the HTTP receiver. The result is always the same 400 response from the BZSt service, so it does not appear to be a simple syntax issue in the JSON itself.

What could be the reason for this behavior, and does anyone know how to resolve it or what else we should check?

Here is how the iFlow is built and the error messages:

entry.title: Using exchange properties in xPath
entry.content:
Hi,

I'm working on an Integration Flow in SAP Cloud Integration, where I use a content modifier. There, I want to get the content of a node via xPath. But not in the form of "//d;AccountID[1]/text()", but i want the "1" to be a variable. The exchange property is already created and called activeIndex. I tried //d;AccountID[$activeIndex]/text() but it doesn't work. Can anyone help?

Thank you

entry.title: Issue with Position, Job and Org Unit Data Not Replicating to ECP
entry.content: I am trying to identify why the position, job, and organizational unit data from SuccessFactors are not integrating into ECP. The records are not being updated. Could you please advise me on where I can identify the root cause of this issue?

entry.title: SAP Edge Integration Cell Offline Mode
entry.content:
Hi SAP Experts,

We are going to leverage Hybrid solution of Integration Suite and I have few open questions.

Could any one from SAP reply on this and share any documentation ?

1) Offline mode for Edge Integration Cell ( where no connectivity between Cloud and On-premises), As per SAP, they don’t provide any support after 48 hours of offline mode.

Is Edge Cell runtime will stop processing after 48 hours ?
Or
There is any option to extent support from SAP side.

2) Can we start/stop or re-send message from Edge Cell directly during offline mode ?
As per SAP documentation, it’s only possible from cloud.

Is there any solution or custom development required to action on those messages or channel during offline mode ?

Thanks,
Bijaya

entry.title: An error occurred during message processing and no retry has been trigger
entry.content:
I observed the following status in monitoring:
“An error occurred during message processing and no retry has been triggered.”

I’m using the XI sender adapter with Delivery Assurance configured as JMS queues. However, when the connection drops at the receiver end, my interface does not retry. Instead, the status is escalated, and I see the above message.

My initial conclusion is that this might be due to the exception subprocess in my integration flow, which ends with an Escalation End Event. Could this be preventing the retry?

I’d appreciate help in understanding this behavior and the correct configuration to enable retries.

entry.title: SAP BTP Integration Suite Cloud to SAP S4 Private Cloud
entry.content:
Dear All,

Good Day!

Is there any documentation/steps to integrate SAP BTP Integration Suite Cloud to SAP S4 Private Cloud via Oauth2.0 Bearer Token.

Am not finding any documentation from SAP.

Thanks and Regards,

Rajesh PS

entry.title: Error: While connecting from SAP BTP Integration Suite to SAP S4 Cloud Odata
entry.content:
Hello Team,

 

I'm getting below error while connecting from SAP BTP Integration Suite Cloud to SAP S4 Cloud Odata service.

"com.sap.gateway.core.ip.component.odata.exception.OsciException: HTTP Request failed with error : <HOST>: No address associated with hostname, cause: java.net.UnknownHostException: <HOST>: No address associated with hostname"

 

 

 

Thanks and Regards,

Rajesh PS

entry.title: How to consume s4 hana public cloud SOAP Outbound Service in CPI for replication
entry.content:
Hii Community,

Can someone help me out how to configure my Sender(S4 Public Cloud) and Consumer(CPI) system to replicate production order data from S4 to MES System through CPI?

I got replication SOAP service from api.sap.com which needs to be activated in SAP. Let me know if someone has done this kind of integration.

I appreciate your attention on question

Regards,

Omkar

entry.title: How to Export Analytical Model Output from SAP Datasphere to Azure Data Lake Storage?
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am working on a requirement where I need to export the output of an Analytical Model in SAP Datasphere into Azure Data Lake Storage (ADLS).

Connections to both Datasphere and Azure are already established.

Question:
Is there a way to export Analytical Model data into ADLS?

I attempted to create a Replication Flow with Datasphere as the source. However, when selecting the source object, I only see:

  • Local Tables

  • Fact Views

  • Dimension Views

The Analytical Models do not appear as selectable source objects.

Has anyone implemented this scenario or knows if Analytical Models are supported in Replication Flows or if there is an alternative approach?

Thanks in advance!

 

SAP Datasphere Cloud Integration Cloud Connector

entry.title: How to set trigger for Integration Suite for periodic 1st Tuesday but except holiday.
entry.content:
Hi I’m wondering how to set periodic timer event for Integration Suite.

That condition is trigger the iFlow in every month every week in certain day but except national holiday or company holiday.

I found a similar case in SAP community in following link.

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-integration-suite-advanced-scheduler-configuration/ba-p/13564143 

But I need to do more for customers request for restricting the trigger for national holiday or company holiday.

Please somebody give me your knowledge for guiding me for this area.

Thank you for in advance.

Sincerely 

T.N

entry.title: Alert Retry Mechanism
entry.content: Im having a scenario where I will send data to target via mail so that if any error occurs in the iflow it should retry that error. When the error is resolved in the iflow it should automatically stop the retry and process and it needs to send data to the target via mail.

entry.title: MDI to Planon Integration delta token not matching
entry.content:
We've recently established connection with Planon with S4 HANA Public Cloud. We've managed to push/pull some data.

Then I've tried to set up the BP resulting to recreating the MDI service instance.

After updating the credentials of impacted config, we can no longer sync to Planon. Planon says they are getting a delta token not matching error. They already tried restarting their app but still no go.

2025-12-10 17:23:48,100 [ERROR] [pnlog.APP.planonsoftware.com.planonrealestatemanagementforsap.servermodule.com.planon.sap.scheduledtask.SyncVersionIdsTask] Exception occured while executing SyncVersionIdsTask: SyncService-BTP response Code: 400, message: {"error":{"code":"DeltaTokenDoesNotMatchRequest","message":"The consuming system or requested entity type and version does not match the delta token. Please only use delta tokens in the context of one consuming system, entity type and version.","details":[]}} : com.planonsoftware.platform.backend.connector.v2.MessageDiscardException: SyncService-BTP response Code: 400, message: {"error":{"code":"DeltaTokenDoesNotMatchRequest","message":"The consuming system or requested entity type and version does not match the delta token. Please only use delta tokens in the context of one consuming system, entity type and version.","details":[]}}

What can we do with this issue?

entry.title: SAP Integration Cell support
entry.content:
We are deploying Rancher to manage the Kubernetes cluster where the SAP Integration Cell will be hosted. According to the documentation, SAP requires Rancher as a prerequisite to manage the cluster; however, there is no mention of any requirements related to the virtualization layer.
 
Could you please confirm whether there are any requirements at the hypervisor layer from SAP’s perspective to manage Rancher and Kubernetes? Specifically, is VMware ESXi required, or is it also possible to use a KVM-based hypervisor? As far as we checked,  "The hypervisor is considered out of scope from SAP perspective"

entry.content:

I have checked url , endpoint, certificate is aligned , everything seems to be fine but still i am getting this error.

Could anyone help with this.

I follow below blog .

Client Certificate Authentication for Integration ... - SAP Community
